intro: Potentilla alchimilloides subsp. alchimilloides, commonly known as alpine potentilla, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia, where it thrives in rocky and alpine environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring narrow, linear leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. It is well adapted to cold climates and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and scree slopes. Due to its hardiness and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in temperate regions.
